results.purpose: Tracks CMA (Consumer & Marketing Area) squad organization, ownership, KPIs, and resources for Q1 2026
key_data_points: Q1 2026 KPIs defined for most squads
Mix of business metrics (revenue, conversion rates) and technical metrics (API endpoints, deployment frequency)
Key KPIs include: Profile Completion Rate, Menu Add-to-Cart Rate, Predicted CLV, Self Service Rate, Net Revenue, API-v2 endpoint migration, deployment frequency

entities.name: Shopping Journey
entities.context: Tribe containing Customer Profile, Menu Discovery, Merchandising, and Feedback squads

entities.name: Shopping Foundation
entities.context: Tribe focused on Personalization, Cart, Shopping Platform, Customer Service, and Cross-Selling

entities.name: New Ventures
entities.context: Tribe managing Factor Form, Good Chop, The Pets Table, and Market Innovation brands

entities.name: Consumer Core
entities.context: Tribe handling Customers, Plans, Deliveries & Orders, and Monoliths - focused on API-v2 migration

entities.name: Consumer Foundations
entities.context: Tribe with Consumer Acceleration and Client Platform squads - focused on developer productivity

entities.name: Engagement
entities.context: Tribe with Inspire and Act squads - focused on app engagement and recipe features

entities.name: Loyalty & Virality
entities.context: Tribe managing Share, Missions, and Rewards squads - focused on retention and growth

entities.name: Factor Form
entities.context: New venture brand at factor75.com with penetration KPI

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: New venture brand at goodchop.com tracking net revenue

entities.name: The Pets Table
entities.context: New venture pet food brand at thepetstable.com tracking net revenue

entities.name: Fiona Lucas
entities.context: PM for entire Consumer Core tribe (4 squads)

entities.name: UX
entities.context: Tribe with Insights & Innovation and Content Design & Localization squads - incomplete data

insights: Consumer Core tribe is heavily focused on API-v2 migration with consistent KPI across squads
New Ventures squads are revenue-focused, indicating commercialization phase
Shopping Foundation has the most squads (5), suggesting it's a critical area
Several Jira project links are noted as inaccessible ('Can't find link')
UX tribe has incomplete information with no PM, EM, or KPIs listed
Each squad has dedicated Slack channels for communication
Mix of interim and incoming leadership (e.g., Bartosz Raciborski starting Jan 1st)
Consumer Foundations focuses on internal productivity metrics rather than customer-facing KPIs
Engagement tribe targets app adoption and daily active user metrics
All squads have clear ownership with assigned PM and EM roles

results.purpose: Recipe management and menu planning workflow for HelloFresh Canada (HFCA) Customer Choice Menu (CCM), tracking weekly recipe configurations, labels, tags, and promotional campaigns
key_data_points: 15 step workflow checklist for weekly menu setup
Weekly promotional themes tracked from W01 2024 through W47 2025
Monthly themes running on 3 parent slots
Regional surcharges for ON, AB, BC provinces

entities.name: HelloFresh Canada (HFCA)
entities.context: Primary brand operating the CCM recipe system

entities.name: CCM (Customer Choice Menu)
entities.context: Menu management platform where recipes are uploaded and activated

entities.name: Product Calendar
entities.context: Reference document for product-specific launches and menu updates

entities.name: #hfc_weekly_menuplanning
entities.context: Slack channel for weekly menu planning coordination

entities.name: CPS
entities.context: System where missing recipe information must be updated

entities.name: HC (HelloChef)
entities.context: Team/system responsible for uploading menus into CCM

entities.name: Naomi Harper
entities.context: Contact person for Protein Plus label logic questions

entities.name: Cat & Nat
entities.context: Partnership running W36-39 2025

entities.name: The Office
entities.context: Promotional theme for W43-44 2025

insights: Complex multi-week promotional calendar with overlapping campaigns (seasonal themes, partnerships, product lines)
Recipe tagging system includes: Veggie, Family Friendly, Spicy, Carb Smart, Cal Smart, Protein Plus, One Pot/Pan, Sheet Pan, Global Cuisine, Dinner Bowls
Workflow requires coordination across multiple systems: Slack, Product Calendar, CPS, CCM
Quality assurance happens at multiple stages: initial upload, final upload (columns S & T), and post-activation on live site
Regional pricing variations with province-specific surcharges (ON, AB, BC)
Health-focused product line expansion starting W34 2025 (slots 1085-1094)
Seasonal programming follows Canadian calendar (Winter Warmers, Fall Flavours, Summer, Earth Month)
Critical timing note: work must be completed week before upload to be ready for HC team
Data integrity requirement: must copy and paste values to lock in data for T+0 or T+1 tabs
Evolution of labeling logic: 'feel-good' label discontinued W10+ 2025, replaced with TAG-based Protein Plus logic
